headline: After Disastrous First-Quarter Sales, Tesla's Stock Is Down 36% This Year. It Can Go Lower
summary: Rising competition and the negative impact of Tesla CEO Elon Musk and his role with the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) appear to have been the main culprits.  Tesla's core business is making and selling electric vehicles, and this business seems to be feeling the heat.  As electric vehicle sales have seemingly been on the rise, Tesla has seen sales fall in Europe and China.
